page.title: 17RAILWAY MANIA cont.
page.content: In 1982 the engine arrived from British Rail,Doncaster,causing great excitment.Problems were caused by the steep gradient of the road which is 1 in 5 to 1 in 7.Whitley Head is about 600feet above sea level.The road had to be closed while a specially hired crane attempted to place the engine in Mr.Kevin Cox's back garden.Specially strengthened planks were used whilst the engine weighing several tonnes was being manoeuvered into place. The event attracted a lot of attention from newspapers and regional television. The engine has now been renovated and painted and Mr.Cox's children use it to play in,while Mr.Cox tries to keep it in good condition.
